meanings.sent1: The uncivilized man spoke loudly in the quiet library.
meanings.sent2: It is considered uncivilized to talk with your mouth full.
meanings.sent3: The uncivilized behavior of the dog made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her uncivilized manners were like a wild storm disrupting the calm.
meanings.sent5: The uncivilized painting stood out among the elegant artworks.

meanings.definition: Not adhering to social norms or conventions
meanings.sent1: She felt uncivilized wearing pajamas to the fancy dinner party.
meanings.sent2: It is uncivilized to interrupt someone while they are speaking.
meanings.sent3: His uncivilized choice of outfit raised eyebrows at the event.
meanings.sent4: The uncivilized behavior of the guests shocked the host.
meanings.sent5: The uncivilized act of cutting in line angered the other customers.

meanings.definition: Barbaric or primitive in behavior or customs
meanings.sent1: The uncivilized tribe lived deep in the jungle.
meanings.sent2: It is uncivilized to settle disputes through violence.
meanings.sent3: The uncivilized dance of the children entertained the crowd.
meanings.sent4: Their uncivilized traditions clashed with modern society.
meanings.sent5: The uncivilized rituals of the ancient civilization were fascinating.
